main.name: Annachiara Korchmaros
main.description: For the last nine months I have been actively working on two projects in the applied non linear algebra group at Aalto. In my main project, I have been working in reconstructing the 3D DNA structure of diploid organisms using algebraic geometry and polynomial optimization techniques. I have been also working on estimating the dimensionality of the neuronal manifold in mice using an algebraic geometry approach. As side project I have been studying the structure of 2-colored best match graphs.
main.bio: Thank you for checking out my website. I have a master and doctoral degree in mathematics, and I am particularly interested in applying graph theory, algebraic geometry, and statistics to address issues in neuroscience and genetics. After finishing my doctoral degree, I moved to the US where I graduated with a master in bioinformatics and worked as neuroimaging data analyst for a year. I started my first post doctorate in mathematics in Finland, Aalto University, on December 2019 where I worked in applied non linear algebra and graph theory. I joined the Bioinformatics Leipzig group lead by Prof. Dr. Peter F Stadler in June 2021 to work on graphs and their applications to estimate phylogenetic trees. Outside work I love spending time with friends and family, meditating, cycling, pilates, hiking, and all kind of outdoor activities.
main.contactmessage: Thanks for stopping by! I am working at Leipzig University studying the structure of best match graphs, their generalizations, and their applications to estimate phylogenetic trees. Feel free to contact me if you want to collaborate!

resume.skillmessage: Be open to learn, unlearn and relearn.

education.school: University of Basilicata, International Doctoral Seminar János Bolyai
education.description: Learned about DNA rearrangements and studied the Cayley graph associated to DNA transpositions.
Studied in particular algebraic geometry and its application to aligning DNA sequences.
My first steps toward college mathematics.
